intro: Cryptantha sobolifera, commonly known as the desert flax. It is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. This species belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, blue to purple flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
